title: Revision of Civil Immigration Enforcement Policies and Priorities

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the federal government to change how civil immigration laws are enforced, prioritizing national security, humanitarian concerns, public health, and due process while revoking a previous order that emphasized interior immigration enforcement. It requires agencies to review and update policies to align with a more balanced and values-driven approach to immigration enforcement.
potential_concerns: Changing enforcement priorities may lead to disagreements over the adequacy of border and interior enforcement efforts.
There could be challenges in balancing humanitarian protections with the need for effective national security measures.
Implementation may strain resources as agencies revise guidance and policies amid evolving legal interpretations.
Critics might argue that relaxing enforcement undermines the rule of law or public safety in some communities.
